datamodel.interfaces

Interface IDeliveryRecord

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IObserver, ISubject
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Customer, DeliveryRecord

    public interface IDeliveryRecord
extends ISubject, IObserver
    This interface represents the "abstract concept" of a delivery record for a customer. A delivery record is simply a list of all fast courier delivers made on behalf of a customer.

    • Method Summary

      This method adds a new delivery to the list of deliveries being managed by this delivery record.

        update

    • Method Detail

      • addDelivery

        boolean addDelivery(Delivery newDelivery)
        This method adds a new delivery to the list of deliveries being managed by this delivery record. The cost per kg delivered should be set to the customers default cost
        Parameters:
        newDelivery - - The Delivery object to add to this delivery records list.
        Returns:
        - boolean True if the delivery was added to the record, false otherwise.

      • addDelivery

        boolean addDelivery(Delivery newDelivery,
                  java.lang.Double costPerKg)
        This method adds a new delivery to the list of deliveries being managed by this delivery record. The cost per kg delivered should be set to the value provided by the costPerKg parameter
        Parameters:
        newDelivery - - The Delivery object to add to this delivery records list.
        costPerKg - - The cost per a kg delivered to be used when pricing this delivery
        Returns:
        - boolean True if the delivery was added to the record, false otherwise.

      • getDeliveryAt

        Delivery getDeliveryAt(int index)
                       throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Deliveries are stored in the order they are added. This method retrieves the delivery specified by the given zero based index number
        Parameters:
        index - - The zero based index number for the required delivery. For example the first delivery added to the record may be retrieved by using an index of 0, the second by and index of 1 etc.
        Returns:
        - The retrieved Delivery object or NULL if no object was found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - - if the value of the index parameter is negative or greater than or equal to the value returned by a call to the getNoOfDeliveries() method

      • updateDeliveryStatus

        void updateDeliveryStatus(int index,
                        DeliveryStatus newStatus)
                          throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        This method changes the delivery status for a specified delivery
        Parameters:
        index - - The zero based index number for the delivery to update.
        newStatus - - A DeliveryStatus enumerated value which the specified deliveries status should be changed to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - - if the value of the index parameter is negative or greater than or equal to the value returned by a call to the getNoOfDeliveries() method

      • getDeliveriesByStatus

        java.util.ArrayList<Delivery> getDeliveriesByStatus(DeliveryStatus status)
        This method retrieves an array list of delivery objects stored in this delivery that have a delivery status matching the provided status parameter.
        Parameters:
        status - - A DeliveryStatus enumerated value, the list of all deliveries stored by this delivery record will be filtered so that the returned list only includes deliveries with a delivery status that matches this value.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of delivery objects stored in this delivery record with a delivery status that matches the status parameter

      • clearAll

        void clearAll()
        This method removes all deliveries stored in this delivery record. After this method completes a call to getNoOfDeliveries() is guaranteed to return a value of zero (0).

      • getNoOfDeliveries

        int getNoOfDeliveries()
        This method retrieves the total number of delivery objects stored by this delivery record
        Returns:
        An int being the total number of delivery objects stored in this delivery record.

      • getIndexOfDelivery

        int getIndexOfDelivery(Delivery aDelivery)
        This method tests to determine if the specified delivery object is stored by this delivery record. If so the deliveries zero based index number is retrieved. Otherwise a value of -1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        aDelivery - - A delivery object for which the index number is required
        Returns:
        - An int being the deliveries zero based index number or -1 if the delivery record does not hold the delivery
